2.8. When will data be copied?

  • Show Source

2.7. Save/Load¶

We can also save/read Tensor to/from file.

2.7.1. Save a Tensor¶

To save a Tensor to file, simply call Tensor.Save(filepath).

  • In python:

1
2
A = cytnx.arange(12).reshape(3,4)
A.Save("T1")

  • In c++:

1
2
auto A = cytnx::arange(12).reshape(3,4);
A.Save("T1")

This will save Tensor A to the current directory as T1.cytn, with extension .cytn

2.7.2. Load a Tensor¶

Now, let’s try to load the Tensor from the file.

  • In python:

1
2
A = cytnx.Tensor.Load("T1.cytn")
print(A)

  • In c++:

1
2
auto A = cytnx::Tensor::Load("T1.cytn");
cout << A << endl;

Output>>

Total elem: 12
type  : Double (Float64)
cytnx device: CPU
Shape : (3,4)
[[0.00000e+00 1.00000e+00 2.00000e+00 3.00000e+00 ]
 [4.00000e+00 5.00000e+00 6.00000e+00 7.00000e+00 ]
 [8.00000e+00 9.00000e+00 1.00000e+01 1.10000e+01 ]]
